wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Walters (1811 - 1882) was an English maritime artist, considered to be the most enduring figures of the Liverpool School of Marine Art. His father, Miles Walters, was also a (less notable) maritime artist. He was born in London and moved to Liverpool, where he was well known. His work was also popular in North America.

response: The Burning of the Ocean Monarch off the Great Orme is a series of three paintings by British artist Samuel Walters (1811–1882).
Samuel Walters may also refer to:
*Samuel Walters, candidate for Burin—Burgeo electoral district
Samuel Walters, an English maritime artist painted the Pomona in 1858.
